pacman.controller

Interface NetworkController

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PacmanController

    public interface NetworkController
    This interface defines basic actions that a controller with networking should support.
    Version:
    1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean changePort(java.lang.String port, boolean confirm)
      This method changes the port number of the local host and reset the server.
      void closeServer()
      This method closes the server.
      boolean connectTo(java.lang.String address, java.lang.String port, boolean updateViewer)
      This function let the server connect to a remote host on its own initiative.
      java.util.Set<java.net.SocketAddress> getClientList()
      This method gets the list of connected clients.
      int getLocalPort()
      This method gets the port of the local server.
      void hostCloseConnection()
      This method closes the connection.
      boolean incomingConnection(java.net.SocketAddress remoteSocketAddress, int port)
      This method gets called once an incoming connection is sent to the host.
      boolean isConnected()
      This method checks if any connection (server/client) is connected with local host.
      boolean isServerStarted()
      This method gets the status of the local server.
      void receiveRemoteMessage(java.net.SocketAddress from, java.lang.String message)
      This method gets called when the remote side sends a message.
      void remoteCloseConnection(java.net.SocketAddress remoteSocketAddress)
      This method gets called when the remote side closes the connection.

    • Method Detail

      • getLocalPort

        int getLocalPort()
        This method gets the port of the local server.
        Returns:
        the local port of the host

      • isServerStarted

        boolean isServerStarted()
        This method gets the status of the local server.
        Returns:
        true if local server is started and false otherwise

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        This method checks if any connection (server/client) is connected with local host.
        Returns:
        true if connected and false otherwise

      • changePort

        boolean changePort(java.lang.String port,
                   boolean confirm)
        This method changes the port number of the local host and reset the server.
        Parameters:
        port - the local port of the host
        confirm - if a confirm should be sent
        Returns:
        if the server is reestablished

      • incomingConnection

        boolean incomingConnection(java.net.SocketAddress remoteSocketAddress,
                           int port)
        This method gets called once an incoming connection is sent to the host.
        Parameters:
        remoteSocketAddress - the address of the remote side
        port - the port of the remote side
        Returns:
        if the user accepts the connection

      • closeServer

        void closeServer()
        This method closes the server.

      • connectTo

        boolean connectTo(java.lang.String address,
                  java.lang.String port,
                  boolean updateViewer)
        This function let the server connect to a remote host on its own initiative.
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the remote host
        port - the port of the remote host
        updateViewer - if the viewer will be updated to reflect the connection
        Returns:
        if the connection is created

      • hostCloseConnection

        void hostCloseConnection()
        This method closes the connection.

      • remoteCloseConnection

        void remoteCloseConnection(java.net.SocketAddress remoteSocketAddress)
        This method gets called when the remote side closes the connection.
        Parameters:
        remoteSocketAddress - the address of the remote side

      • receiveRemoteMessage

        void receiveRemoteMessage(java.net.SocketAddress from,
                          java.lang.String message)
        This method gets called when the remote side sends a message.
        Parameters:
        from - who sent this message
        message - the message content

      • getClientList

        java.util.Set<java.net.SocketAddress> getClientList()
        This method gets the list of connected clients.
        Returns:
        a set containing the addresses of all connected clients
